summary.p: The bearer is reliable. The Zurich delegates were admonished before their departure to the Diet (on January 15) to sincerely accept all proposals from the Basel or Bern representatives. Hopes that a strong friendship will develop if the Basel representatives are not deterred by hostile lies! Requests news from abroad.

div.p: This man is faithful, our singular friend, to whom you can safely entrust anything you have.

Our delegates, sent to Baden, were diligently instructed to sincerely accept anything offered by you or the Bernese. I hope a strong friendship will develop between them, provided your people are not deterred by the deceit of certain impious individuals.
Our affairs otherwise are not in a bad state. If you have any certain news from Strasbourg or Augsburg, or from the French or Italian front, let me know, if it is worth knowing.
Farewell, and remember us in your prayers.
To Lord Oswald Myconius, the most vigilant bishop of the people of Basel, dearest brother.
